intro: Tanacetum zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the Zahner's tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
